modules.description: Constructs and manipulates color values using RGB tuples. Provides functions to create colors from red, green, and blue components and defines standard color constants. Used for generating color representations in graphics or visualization tasks.

Creates drawable representations from abstract domains like boxes, octagons, and polyhedra, as well as from generators, constraints, convex hulls, and hypercubes. Operates on types such as variables, points, and ranges to construct geometric abstractions. Combines drawable objects through union or product to visualize overlapping or combined regions.

Handles 2D scene creation, element registration, and transformations. Operates on scenes represented as a type `t`, incorporating drawable elements and color associations. Enables dynamic adjustment of camera settings when adding elements, supports translation and scaling for visual manipulation.

Initializes a 3D scene with labeled axes and adds individual or multiple abstract elements with specified colors. Operates on a scene type `t` and associates colors with drawable objects. Used to construct 3D visualizations of mathematical or geometric abstractions.

Handles geometric transformations and projections for high-dimensional data, including scaling, rotation, and orthographic mapping. Operates on vectors, matrices, and n-dimensional points to facilitate 2D visualization. Enables rendering of complex mathematical structures like hyperplanes and fractals in graphical interfaces.

combines color manipulation, geometric construction, and scene rendering to create visual representations of abstract mathematical structures. It supports RGB color operations, geometric shapes and transformations, and 2D/3D scene management with dynamic camera controls. Users can generate colored shapes, combine geometric regions, and render complex visualizations with labeled axes. Examples include drawing a red octagon, combining a box and a sphere, and displaying a 3D coordinate system with custom-colored elements.
